_prev_prog_2.EquipmentTested: The propane tank, vaporizer and associated components.
_prev_prog_2.Description:
According to the RMP guidelines our facility is classified as a "Program 2" facility. The propane stored at our facility is used for back up power supply. Occasionally, the local Gas Company informs us that our power supply will be interrupted. When this happens we use the propane. Our power has been interrupted from 6 to 48 hours.

The prevention program instituted at Mondovi Foods ensures that the elements of the RMP are integrated and implemented on an as needed basis, and accountability and responsibility for the overall program and for each element of the program.

Our hazard prevention program is being developed in accordance to the guidelines in Section 68.170. The following activities are being done or will be done to ensure compliance with the RMP.

Safety- Maintain a MSDS on propane, document NFPA 58, and maintain propane equipment vendor-supplied information.

Hazard Review-Review compliance with NFPA 58, and use EPA checklist on propane.

Operating Procedures-Comply with NFPA 58, and comply with NPGA safety bulletins.

Training-Conduct training to comply with NFPA 58, complies with NPGA Safety bulletins, and provides refresher training.

Maintenance-Use EPA checklist, established maintenance and testing schedule, and document inspection and maintenance did by equipment vendors.

Compliance Audits-Conduct audit every two years and abate identified problems in a timely manner.

Incident Investigation-Implement practices in NPGA's LP-Gas Safety handbook and Implement NPGA Bulletin #202-93.

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Mondovi Foods complies with NFPA 58 requirements for LP-Gas storage, and it is our policy to meet or exceed all applicable federal, state, and local regulations. If an emergency were to occur, it is our policy to notify the Mondovi Fire Department and request that they respond to the emergency.

Mondovi Foods is processor of Pet Food related products. We use propane for back-up power supply. The pilot on the vaporizer is lit in December and stays lit until April. When the local gas company inform us that there will be a power interruption, we will use the propane for back-up power supply. Normally, the power can be interrupted from 6 to 48 hours. The propane tank at this facility has a 30,000-gallon capacity. The tanks are normally filled to half of its capacity.

Our worst case- scenario is failure of the 30,000-gallon storage tank resulting in a vapor cloud explosion. The resulting distance to the endpoint is .15 miles. There are public receptors within this distance. Our alternative case scenario is determine to be identical to the worse case scenario, the difference will be maximum computed release rates. The estimate population within the endpoint is 200.

Mondovi Foods complies with the EPA's accident prevention rule and all applicable state and local codes and regulations. The propane system is designed, installed and maintained in accordance with NFPA-58.

We have had no incident in the past five years. 

In the event of an emergency involving our propane system, it is our policy to notify the Mondovi Fire Department and request that they respond to the emergency. We have discussed this policy with the fire department; and they are familiar with our propane system.
